Interface NeuralNetwork

All Superinterfaces:
EstimationFunction, TrainableFunction
All Known Implementing Classes:
Adaline, DefaultNeuralNetwork, MultiLayerPerceptron, Perceptron
@DomainObject @Entity public interface NeuralNetwork extends TrainableFunction
Represents a neural network as a specific kind of EstimationFunction.

A neural network consists of multiple layers of Neurons connected through weighted edges. This interface exposes structural information (layers, neurons, connections), parameter management, and initialization capabilities. It does not prescribe a specific network architecture (e.g., fully connected, convolutional, recurrent).

Responsibilities:

  • Expose the topology of the network in terms of layers and neurons.
  • Provide access to parameters (weights, biases) for training and persistence.
  • Support initialization of parameters through an NeuralNetworkInitializer.
  • Inherit evaluation capabilities from EstimationFunction, such as mapping inputs to outputs.

  • Method Details

    • getWidth

      int getWidth(int l)
      Returns the number of neurons in the given layer.
      Parameters:
      l - the layer index (0-based, where 0 is the input layer)
      Returns:
      the number of neurons in that layer
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the layer index is invalid

    • getDepth

      int getDepth()
      Returns the total number of layers in the network, including input and output layers.
      Returns:
      the depth of the network

    • getNeuron

      Neuron getNeuron(int l, int j)
      Returns a specific neuron in the network by its layer and index.
      Parameters:
      l - the layer index (0-based)
      j - the index of the neuron within the layer (0-based)
      Returns:
      the neuron at the specified position
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the indices are invalid

    • getNeuron

      <N extends Neuron> N getNeuron(int l, int j, Class<N> classType)
      Returns a specific neuron in the network by its layer and index.
      Parameters:
      l - the layer index (0-based)
      j - the index of the neuron within the layer (0-based)
      classType - the class of the neuron to be returned
      Returns:
      the neuron at the specified position
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the indices are invalid

    • getOutputConnections

      Map<Neuron,Float> getOutputConnections(int l, int j)
      Returns the outgoing connections of a given neuron in the network.

      Each connection is represented as a mapping from a target neuron to the weight of the connection.

      Parameters:
      l - the layer index of the source neuron
      j - the index of the source neuron within the layer
      Returns:
      a map of target neurons to their associated connection weights

    • getTargetNeurons

      Set<Neuron> getTargetNeurons(Neuron neuron)
      Returns the target neurons of the given neuron (thus the downstream nodeds).
      Parameters:
      neuron - the neuron for which the targets are returned
      Returns:
      the target neurons

    • getParameterCount

      int getParameterCount()
      Returns the total number of trainable parameters in the network (typically weights + biases).
      Specified by:
      getParameterCount in interface TrainableFunction
      Returns:
      the number of parameters

    • getParameters

      float[] getParameters()
      Returns all parameters (weights, biases) of the network as a flat array.

      The order of parameters is implementation-defined but must be consistent across calls to enable saving and restoring network state.

      Specified by:
      getParameters in interface TrainableFunction
      Returns:
      a flat array of parameters

    • accept

      void accept(NeuronVisitor visitor)
      Accepts a NeuronVisitor to traverse the structure of this neural network. This allows external visitors to analyze, transform, or export the network structure without coupling to its internal implementation.
      Parameters:
      visitor - the visitor to apply to this network
